question: Which volcano is known as the "Lighthouse of the Pacific"?
explanation: Izalco Volcano is an active stratovolcano, which is 1950 metres high, located in the Cordillera de Apaneca parent mountain range of El Salvador. It is located on the southern side of the Santa Ana Volcano. This volcano is also known as "Lighthouse of the Pacific" because of its frequent eruptions between 1770 and 1958. It is the youngest volcano in El Salvador. It is situated near to Cerro Verde National Park. This volcano is mostly seen as the national icon of El Salvador, which can be mostly seen in stamps and currencies.
